      • sortByType

        public void sortByType​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> filenames)
        Separate files by extension and add each file to its appropriate file list If the extension is not recognized, do not add it to any list.
        Parameters:
        filenames - Names of the that need to be sorted

      • getAllFilesInDirectory

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllFilesInDirectory​(java.lang.String dir)
        Collects the filenames of all files in current directory. The files are then sorted into their appropriate lists
        Parameters:
        dir - The directory to gather all files from
        Returns:
        a reader that contains the files

      • getAllDirectoriesInDirectory

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllDirectoriesInDirectory​(java.lang.String dir)
        Helper method for addAllFilesInDirectoryAndSubDirectories, this method gathers all directories in a directory, much in the same way addAllFilesInDirectory does
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory you wish to call this method on
        Returns:
        a list of directories in the given directory

      • getAllFilesInDirectoryAndSubDirectories

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllFilesInDirectoryAndSubDirectories​(java.lang.String dir)
        This method is used to recursively call a directory and get all files within that Directory as well as all files inside directories within those directories
        Parameters:
        dir - the path of the directory you wish to call the method on
        Returns:
        all files within that directory and it's subdirectories
